page.title: 09THE FARMERS YEAR
page.content: {The Farmer's Year The farmer's year starts in{Autumn with{dipping}the sheep and giving them medicines so that they will stay strong and healthy throughout the winter. In{December}all the ewes have rams with them so they will have lambs in Spring.About Christmas time the sheep are taken from{Auchlany}to{Struan {Point}where they are fed on hay,if there is snow on the ground. After{New Year}the rams (tups) are taken away from the ewes and put into the the fields to be fed with grain to build up their strength. From{January to March}the shepherds are feeding the sheep and giving them injections and doses of medicine. From{March to April}they feed
